entities: United Nations Assistance Mission in Somalia (UNSOM)
reporting_cycle: Secretary-General reports every regular interval as part of reports on Somalia
summary:
**Strengthening UNSOS Leadership and Operations**

* The Council welcomes the Secretary-General's intention to streamline administrative and procurement processes in UNSOS and requests the Head of UNSOS to report to the Special Representative of the Secretary-General (SRSG) and through the SRSG to the Security Council (para. 4).

**Environmental Impact and Accountability**

* The Council requests the Secretary-General to consider the environmental impact of UNSOS operations and to support the African Union in developing its environmental policies in Somalia (paras. 6-7).
* The Council underlines the need for full transparency and accountability for resources provided, including those made available through the SNA trust fund (para. 8).

**Logistical Support and AMISOM Force Enablers**

* The Council recognizes that the current logistical arrangements are unsustainable and requests AMISOM and SNA to prioritize securing key supply routes (para. 10).
* The Council renews its call to the AU to expedite the deployment of AMISOM force enablers and multipliers and calls on Member States to support the efforts of the AU (para. 11).

**Support to AMISOM and Somali Security Forces**

* The Council encourages Member States to support AMISOM through financial support, training, and technical assistance (para. 12).
* The Council requests the Secretary-General to work closely with the AU in improving the performance of AMISOM (para. 13).

**Mandate Review and Reporting**

* The Council decides to keep UNSOS' mandate under review and to review and take action to renew or revise the provisions set out in paragraph 2 before 30 May 2016 (para. 16).
* The Council requests the Secretary-General to report to the Security Council on the implementation of this resolution (para. 17).
